clinical_study.brief_title: Prevalence of Nocturnal Hypoventilation in Neuromuscular Diseases According to Different Definitions
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence of Nocturnal Hypoventilation in Neuromuscular Diseases According to Different Definitions

brief_summary.textblock: Different definitions of nocturnal hypoventilation are used in the recent literature. The investigators aimed to compare the prevalence of nocturnal hypoventilation in a neuromuscular disease's population according to different definitions issued from the literature.

detailed_description.textblock: Different definitions of nocturnal hypoventilation are used in the recent literature. Basing on retrospective data review, we aimed to compare the prevalence of nocturnal hypoventilation in the cohort of neuromuscular disease's patients followed at our reference center, according to different definitions issued from the literature.

primary_outcome.measure: Differences in the prevalence of nocturnal hypoventilation according to different previously proposed definitions
primary_outcome.description: The prevalence of nocturnal hypoventilation (percentage of patients diagnosed as having hypoventilation over the total population) according to the different definition available in the literature will be described

secondary_outcome.description: Concordance between the different diagnostic criteria of hypoventilation

secondary_outcome.measure: sensibility/specificity of the different criteria to identify daytime alveolar hypoventilation (defined on blood gas analysis)
secondary_outcome.description: sensibility/specificity of the different criteria to identify daytime alveolar hypoventilation (defined on blood gas analysis)

secondary_outcome.measure: Prognostic value of the different definitions of nocturnal hypoventilation
secondary_outcome.description: The ability of the examined definition to predict the need for mechanical ventilation will be investigated, defined as appearance of daytime hypercapnia or beginning of mechanical ventilation and/or mortality.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Neuromuscular disease
- Age ≥18 years
- Non mechanically ventilated
Exclusion Criteria:
- Long-term oxygen therapy
